snippet: The agreement by the coup leaders to yield power should free Mali to focus on its other big problem: a rebellion in the north.
abstract: Political leaders in Mali welcome an accord signed by the junta that seized power in March in which it agreed to step down and hand power to the president of the National Assembly; agreement is intended to pave the way for elections to choose a new president

byline.original: By LYDIA POLGREEN and FABIEN OFFNER
byline.contributor: Lydia Polgreen reported from Johannesburg, and Fabien Offner from Bamako, Mali.

lead_paragraph: The agreement by the coup leaders to yield power should free Mali to focus on its other big problem: a rebellion in the north.

headline.seo: Junta in Mali Agrees to Step Down
headline.main: Junta in Mali to Step Down
headline.print_headline: Junta in Mali To Step Down

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
